description: Adapted in the 1640s from Dutch Low Saxon or German Low German Kraanbeere, from Kraan m (which means and is cognate to crane) + Beere f (which means and is cognate to berry).

entries.meaning: Of the intense red colour of a cranberry.
examples: Leon was in his most resplendent, gaudiest, Day-Glo getup, including a purple felt fez with multiple hangy-downs and a cranberry vestment with gold collar, appliquéd with every religious symbol known to man  […]

entries.meaning: (countable) A shrub belonging to the section Vaccinium sect. Oxycoccus of the genus Vaccinium.
(countable) The edible red berry of that shrub.
An intense red colour, like that of a cranberry
